item.title: Help me and i'll REP++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:9, topic:416178”]It’s pretty self explanatory,you know how when you click “City teleports”, whats it do?
It opens the dialogue for you to choose a city.
But how did it open it?
You set the clicking button and the dialogue it would display, now that you’ve gotten the dialogue options showing for the citys, you need to set the city’s clicking buttons.
Same shit for this, no need for team viewer.[/quote]
Yes yes, to let you know im dyslexic so this is the hardest part for me lol. (dialogues) i always end up quitting but ima try. I see what your saying, but what I did was do this

case 9190: c.getItems().addItem(15332, 15); break;
i put it in clickinbuttons but then i got one error saying duplicate case label. And i see why, because I already have case 9190 doing something. But i dont see how i would change the csae number for that

“red” “green” “blue”.

The colours will have their own clicking buttons, than you assign the point deducting to those itself, not as you have it atm.[/quote]

item.title: Help me and i'll REP++
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Should be the same way as you’d set up a dialogue.

There’s the clicking buttons to open up the “Varrock, Lumby, Home”.
Should be “Buy Phat”
“red” “green” “blue”.

The colours will have their own clicking buttons, than you assign the point deducting to those itself, not as you have it atm.

You should clean it up with returns too.

[code] case 36250://15 Overloads
if (c.inWild()) {
c.sendMessage(“You cannot use this feature in the wilderness.”);
return;
}

if (c.votePoints <=35) {
c.sendMessage(“You need 35 Vote Points to buy these items.”);
return;
}

if(c.getItems().freeSlots() <= 15) {
c.sendMessage(“You need at least 15 free inventory slots to use this feature.”);
return;
}

if (c.votePoints >= 35) {
c.getDH().sendOption5(“Red Partyhat”, “Blue Partyhat”, “Green Partyhat”, “Yellow Partyhat”, “White Partyhat”);
// c.getItems().addItem(15332, 15);
// c.votePoints-=35;
c.sendMessage(“You exchange 35 Vote Points for a Partyhat.”);
}
break; [/code]

Than the party hats themself when you click the text will have a clicking button assigned, for there you’d add the check for points + space room shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me and i'll REP++
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Okay so i’m trying to make it so when you click a “buy partyhat” icon I have in my interface it will bring up multiple options for different partyhats. Well I have this so far…

//First Row of Vote Shop by Fernando case 36250://15 Overloads if (c.inWild()) { c.sendMessage("You cannot use this feature in the wilderness."); } else if(c.getItems().freeSlots() <= 15) { c.sendMessage("You need at least 15 free inventory slots to use this feature."); return; } else if (c.votePoints >= 35) { c.getDH().sendOption5("Red Partyhat", "Blue Partyhat", "Green Partyhat", "Yellow Partyhat", "White Partyhat"); c.getItems().addItem(15332, 15); c.votePoints-=35; c.sendMessage("You exchange 35 Vote Points for a Partyhat."); } else if (c.votePoints <=35) { c.sendMessage("You need 35 Vote Points to buy these items."); } break;

So the part highlighted in red gives you an item, but it just gives you it as soon as you click “buy partyhat” it doesn’t let you choose the color. It does bring up the Red partyhat, blue…etc…but they don’t do nothing. The clickingbuttons for them are 9190-9194. I’m just a little lost, if you guys could help it would be great! Thanks [font=comic sans ms]Mopar[/font]!!!

Read full topic
